Topic.Title: Finally - Some Cost Data On Cloud Gaming - Nvidia Grid

Message.Msg: I'm too tired to read further than the tidbit posted at the moment but I'm thinking these costs here are for the company or host of a server costs to stream a game to a user. If so these costs are only what they are putting in. The cost structure is likely very different for everyone else. If they stream single player story games. Most are only 8-16 hr games. so lets say 16 hr game at 40 cents an hour is only $6.40. If they charge more for it than that they would make money. and it says the costs will be halved quickly so profits would get much better.

Message.Title: Python enabled CUDA is a big deal
Message.Msg: This annoucement of accessing CUDA on NVDA GPU's using Python is a big deal for scientists and researchers who want to use CUDA enabled GPU's to run models but lack the C programming expertise that CUDA demands . I'm in the software business and I can tell you this opens the market for HPC GPUs big time. Think of the millions of professors, researchers around the globe who can now pick up a GPU or 2 and begin using it immediately without first learning to pogramm with CUDA

Topic.Title: Supermicro® Powers the Cloud with NVIDIA GRID(TM)

Message.Msg: John Kerry was in Vietnam GTC 2013 will be about the GRID... dwarfing HPC...

Topic.Title: Supermicro® Powers the Cloud with NVIDIA GRID(TM)

Message.Msg: At GTC 2013, Live systems featuring NVIDIA GRID K1 and K2 boards will demonstrate how NVIDIA Kepler(TM) architecture-based technology maximizes server utilization and, when scaled out, can support over 600 users per 42U rack in existing reference designs, and with a forthcoming 4U FatTwin configuration can support 1,800+ users per rack. Combined with increased security and system manageability, NVIDIA GRID delivers the most flexible, accelerated VDI experience for end users. In addition to the demos, Supermicro executives will present strategies and server architecture designs to consider when selecting GPU platforms for HPC, cloud and workstation applications. (excerpts from PR)

Topic.Title: SoftKinetic 3D Vision and Gesture Recognition Solutions Now Available on NVIDIA Tegra Processors and Android

Message.Msg: "SoftKinetic, the world’s leading provider of 3D vision and gesture recognition solutions, today announced that its DepthSense® 3D camera and iisu® gesture recognition middleware are now compatible with NVIDIA® Tegra® mobile processors and Android, giving developers a formidable opportunity to develop and deploy the most innovative 3D gesture-based applications. SoftKinetic is working with NVIDIA to bring full body tracking capabilities to interactive digital entertainment with devices such as NVIDIA’s Project SHIELD, automotive infotainment and navigation systems, and augmented reality applications powered by the Tegra platform. “SoftKinetic is delighted to collaborate with NVIDIA in order to bring our industry-leading gesture recognition technology to the Tegra platform,” said Michel Tombroff, CEO of SoftKinetic. “The capabilities of Tegra, in particular in terms of high-performance computer vision and image processing, allow us to achieve excellent performance for the demanding applications such as video games, and we look forward to extending this to other markets as well.”

Topic.Title: "Key Reversal" AND "Outside Day"

Message.Msg: Mslans- I've been away for the last 4 days caring for my ailing 86 year old mother, and just got back to VT a few minutes ago. So, I missed today's "action", which from what I can see was INaction, but, yes, I DO think the long Bear Market in NVDA is ending, but whether it takes another day, a week, or longer, I certainly can't say. The volume has completely vanished, again, and for the life of me I can't figure out why. The stock certainly has become the plaything of HF Traders, and other than that, it still could be that the company is buying back stock and using a major firm to do that for them, and those folks could be holding the stock DOWN in order to get the company as much stock as possible at the lowest price possible. This, of course, would be VERY GOOD for the company, and by extension, its shareholders, in the long run. The GTC SHOULD be a catalyst for more volume, I would think, and higher prices. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Best, Max

Topic.Title: SoftKinetic 3D Vision and Gesture Recognition Solutions Now Available on NVIDIA Tegra Processors and Android

Message.Msg: Check out Softkinetic's website....Their $299 camera's specs. Middle ware is available. Looks to me like this is a vendor ad on. The Depth Sense 311 (DS311) is a time-of-flight (TOF) 3D camera. It is suitable for short (15cm to 100cm) as well as long range tracking (150cm to 400cm). Ideal product for indoor use - home entertainment use, serious gaming, advertising campaigns, healthcare and more. DS311 cameras are available as professional kits as well as white label products for OEMs. The camera comes with a DepthSense SDK or camera API which gives you access to the depth, confidence and RGB image data. The API is available for Windows and Linux. View API documentation or consult FAQ. DS311 in brief: Short Range Distance : 15cm-1.5m Long Range Distance: 1.5m-4m+ Depth Sensor Resolution: QQVGA (160x120) Color Sensor Resolution: VGA (640x480) Depth Field of View: 57.3° x 42.0° x 73.8° Depth Illumination Source: LED In-built Microphones: Yes (2) Power & Data Connection: USB 2.0 and External Power Camera Size: 24cm(w) 4cm(h) 5cm(d) Manufacturer's Warranty: 1 year For Linux support, please contact sales At SoftKinetic, we believe that providing end-to-end solution makes us unique, combined with our ecoystem of development partners. Our games and application division, SoftKinetic Studios, is dedicated to building the very best gesture based experiences, for the PC, set-top-box, smart TVs and gaming consoles. Operating as a business unit of SoftKinetic, SoftKinetic Studios is constantly pushing the enveloppe of gesture based entertainment and challenging our hardware and software business units for higher quality hardware and tools. This entity, headed by Mike Nichols, formerly executive producer of project Natal (Kinect), operates independently to bring out the best possible content on all available platforms.

Message.Title: PAX EAST 2013 - Finally Gamers get to Touch Project Shield - Hey It's A Start
Message.Msg: PAX East 2013 By Romeo Lavarias On Mon, Mar 18 2013 | Events With PAX East only a week away, NVIDIA GeForce is ready for the three day consumer gaming show. From March 22-24, thousands will descend upon Boston Convention & Exhibition Center in a celebration of gaming culture. If you’re one of these lucky attendees, stop by the NVIDIA booth (#862) to experience the entire NVIDIA gaming arsenal, see the hottest games and let’s not forget about our cool giveaways. For those excited to get their hands on Project SHIELD, we’ll have for the first time playable demos of this highly-anticipated product. In our free play area, dozens of GeForce GTX-powered PCs will be showcasing the latest games like Neverwinter, Starcraft 2: Heart of the Swarm, Metro: Last Light, and many others. And yes, giveaways. There will also be plenty of swag to take home from raffles, a button matching contest and random prizes.

Message.Title: "AMD upgraded by Macquarie on videogame opportunity"
Message.Msg: "AMD upgraded by Macquarie on videogame opportunity" "SAN FRANCISCO (MarketWatch) -- Advanced Micro Devices Inc. AMD +1.92% was upgraded to an outperform rating by Macquarie Capital on Monday morning. In a note to clients, analyst Shawn Webster said Wall Street was underestimating the potential upside for the company's videogame business, given that AMD's chips have been confirmed in the PlayStation 4, and Webster expects the yet-to-be-announced Xbox 720 to include the company's chips as well" Pay attention Nvidia, the market thinks WORKING with game console vendors is a good thing instead of WHINING about being too busy to EARN your keep. Message.Title: PS4's NO SHOW keeps people guessing - Sony ceo: "We still have a long way to go....."
Message.Msg: Despite all the hustle and bustle surrounding Sony's unveiling of the PlayStation 4 last month, one core element was missing - the console itself. Despite showing off a wide array of upcoming games, the new DualShock controller and talking about some of the cool social technology that's going to be integrated, Sony decided that now wasn't the time to show the actual console. In a recent interview with the BBC, Kaz Kirai, the CEO of Sony, stated that the decision was made because "we still have a long way to go before the actual product launch and there are going to be a lot of opportunities for us to talk about and provide additional details on the PS4." "It wasn't actually a launch, we just talked about the console and there will be more information to come. It keeps people guessing and that's a good thing." It's rumoured that Sony will use E3 as a stage to show off the PS4, as they will have a dedicated platform with the majority of the world's media focussed in. It would also be the ideal time for them to show off the hardware to media outlets during the remainder of the show. TAGS: Kaz Hirai, Sony Computer Entertainment, PS4 SOURCE: .gamingunionDOTnet/news/kaz-hirai-ps4-console-no-show-keeps-people-guessing--8935.html#CxCps1IwrXpusDO2.99
